hints.content:
Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones
:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  | :-:
$\blueD5$ | $6$ | $0$ | $0$

The $\blueD5$ in $\blueD5{,}600$ is in  the $\blueD{\text{thousands}}$ place.

Now, let's multiply $\blueD5{,}600\times10$. 


Multiplying by $10$ moves every digit one place to the left.

Ten thousands | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones
:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  | :-:
|$\leftarrow\blueD{\fbox5}$ | $\fbox6$ |${\fbox0}$ | $\fbox0$ 

$\blueD5{,}600\times 10=\blueD56{,}000$

Ten thousands | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones
:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  | :-:
$\blueD5$ | $6$ | $0$ | $0$ | $0$

The $\blueD5$ moves to the $\blueD{\text{ten thousands}}$ place.

question.content:
Multiply.

$5{,}600\times 10$  

**What will be the place value of the $5$ after we multiply?**
